intro: Cytisogenista arborea, commonly known as the tree broom, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3 to 6 meters. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnate, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cytisogenista arborea is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun.
